result.execSummary:
All charges against Kalvontae McKenzie in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kalvontae McKenzie is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kalvontae McKenzie

defendant.name: McKenzie, Kalvontae
defendant.address: 515 W. Moreland Blvd., Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188

records.addlTxt: 2:52 PM Defendant Kalvontae McKenzie in court, in custody. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marrufo.  State moves to dismiss this case as they received a teletype that Illinois has quashed their warrant and is no longer seeking extradition.  Court orders case dismissed.  Defendant to be released from custody.
AMENDED Waiver of extradition, signed by Commissioner David Herring and all parties on August 2, 2022.

02:08 PM Defendant Kalvontae McKenzie in court, in custody, with attorney J Andrew Herbers.    Attorney appears as friend of the court.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court was notified this case was placed back on the calendar as there was an issue with the waiver paperwork.  The Court and parties sign the new waiver of extradition.  THE COURT REMANDS THE DEFENDANT TO THE CUSTODY OF THE WAUKESHA COUNTY JAIL.  State of Illinois is to be notified ASAP that the defendant is available for pick up.  Date remains as previously set.
Review hearing on September 1, 2022 at 09:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Kalvontae McKenzie
Current: 515 W. Moreland Blvd., Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 08-02-2022)
Prior: 3208 Douglas Ave, East St. Louis, IL 62204
Warrant for Commitment, signed by CC Herring on 08/01/2022.

03:20 PM Defendant Kalvontae McKenzie in court, in custody, with State Public Defender Law Intern.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern and Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading. 
State of Illinois is requesting extradition for Count 1: Unlawful Possession of Methamphetamine, in violation of 720 ILCS 646/60(a); Count 2: Aggravated Unlawful Use of Weapons (Class 4), in violation of 720 ILCS 5/24-1.6(a)(1); Count 3: Obstruction of Identification, in violation of 720 ILCS 5/31 -4.5(a).
Court Conducts Waiver of Extradition Colloquy with the defendant.
Defendant waives their right to extradition.
Court accepts the waiver of extradition.
Parties and the court sign the waiver of extradition and Court Commissioner signs the Order for Commitment.
The State gives its bail recommendation.
Defense gives its bail recommendation.

THE COURT REMANDS THE DEFENDANT TO THE CUSTODY OF THE WAUKESHA COUNTY JAIL.

State of Illinois is to be notified ASAP that the defendant is available for pick up.
Court sets matter for a review hearing to ensure the defendant was picked up.  Review hearing scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 09:30 am.
State of Illinois, Madison County Warrant
